availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Marion Fish (Mount Vernon, Kentucky, farmer and Rockcastle County Court clerk)

body.p: Mount Vernon, Kentucky, farmer and court clerk. Kentucky, native. Married to Telitha French Fish in Rockcastle County, Kentucky, on December 8, 1856. Father of Mary Fish and Thomas Fish. Farmer in Rockcastle County in 1860. Clerk of the Rockcastle County Court in Mount Vernon from 1864 to 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Mt. Vernon, p. 548.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Mt. Vernon, Voting District 1, p. 30B.

Find A Grave, "William Marion Fish (1828-1900)," Memorial #5863354, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/5863354 (accessed August 9, 2017).
